$SPI $DIA $AAPL $MSFT $GOOGL Bank of Canada's view on inflation: 
 
- Goods inflation has been low for two decades prior to the pandemic due to efficient supply chain and continuous cost improvements 
- Service inflation has been traditionally the main driver of inflation in Canada 
- The pandemic upend that balance. Unable to spend on services such as gym and travel due to lockdown, people spent their money on goods, just as global supply chains were disrupted 
- Reopening will shift that balance toward its traditional mix. Plus supply chain easing will cool down goods inflation too. 
 
A good read from the 51st state: https://www.bankofcanada.ca/2022/03/economic-progress-report-controlling-inflation/

Also, compare $NIFTYIT.NSE to $NIFTY50.NSE and you'll see good relative strength. So definitely the insitutions see the value of IT .... also, as rates increase, investors usually rotate out of the secular growth stuff to cyclical stocks like industrials, commodities, and banks
